snippet: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment fell to its lowest level since 2008, and housing starts hit their highest since then.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits dropped 37,000 to seasonally adjusted 335,000, lowest level since Jan 2008; figures indicate that American economic recovery remains on track despite uncertain fiscal environment; Commerce Department reports housing starts rose 12.1 percent in December to highest level since June 2008.
lead_paragraph: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment fell to its lowest level since 2008, and housing starts hit their highest since then.

headline.seo: Jobs and Housing Reports Show Resilience in Recovery
headline.main: Jobs and Housing Reports Show Resilience in Recovery
headline.print_headline: Reports on Unemployment and Housing Show Resilience in Economic Recovery
